passages.text: Limited Near- Term Implications from Asian Capacity Rationalization; Upcoming ECL Investor Day

Following up on last week's initial announcement that South Korea will cut 2.7- 3.7mmt of naphtha- cracking capacity (NCC), Reuters reported a follow- up article noting that small and stand- alone crackers are likely the targets of capacity rationalization. Korean producers noted they are evaluating a range of options including capacity closure. Trade sources including S&P Global have already reported earlier in June that HD Hyundai and Lotte Chemical are seeking to merge their naphtha- cracking facilities in Daesan, though companies have not confirmed the consolidation yet. We view limited near- term market impact from Korea's capacity rationalization due to consultants currently expecting the restructuring timeline to take 12- 18 months. Furthermore, S- Oil's Shaheen refinery- integrated petchem complex with 1.8mmtpa ethylene capacity is slated for a 2026 start- up, likely offsetting some capacity closures.

Citi's Asia Chemicals team expects the country's industry operating rates to increase from \(\sim 75\%\) today to \(\sim 95 - 100\%\) following restructuring efforts. Additionally, the team views that despite \(\sim 5.7mmt\) of global ethylene capacity closures announced since 2024, another \(\sim 12mmt\) likely needs to come offline to support 2027E utilization rates back to previous trough levels of \(\sim 85\%\) , even after accounting for \(\sim 3mmt\) Korean capacity rationalization (see note here). Separately, the team also noted that on China's phase- out of aging petrochemical facilities, all crackers \(>20\) years old are currently owned by Sinopec and PetroChina, which have upgrade plans for \(>7\) sites. Also, with a structural imbalance due to declining gasoline/diesel demand, there will likely be a limited impact on the E/PE chain.

Earlier this week, we published our preview note on ECL's upcoming Investor Day in Minnesota next Thursday (Sept 4th). We largely expect management to reaffirm and expand on its three key financial targets set at its most recent Investor Day in 2023: 1) \(20\% +\) operating margin, 2) 12- 15% long- term EPS growth, and 3) 5- 7% organic sales growth. With management already reiterating the 12- 15% adj EPS growth algorithm in 2025 and 2026 and hinting at 2025 operating margins to reach 18% and expand to \(20\% +\) by 2027 due to growth in high- margin businesses, value pricing share gains, and productivity improvements during the 2Q25 earnings call, we believe management will provide more color on the path to margin expansion. We currently bake in a \(\sim 170\) bps margin expansion from FY25 to FY27 and model \(\sim 14\%\) EPS growth in both FY25/26 (our note here).
See Appendix A- 1 for Analyst Certification, Important Disclosures and Research Analyst Affiliations.

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

- New home sales decreased \(0.6\%\) M/M in July following an upwardly-revised June print. The median sales price of new homes sold in July was \(-\) 404k, down \(-1\%\) M/M and \(-6\%\) Y/Y. (Census of the Bureau, 8/25/25)- Durable goods orders fell \(-3\%\) M/M in July as aircraft orders continued to normalize. Excluding transportation, orders rose \(-1\%\) M/M, above expectations. (Census of the Bureau, 8/26/25)- The Conference Board consumer confidence index modestly fell from 98.7 in July to 97.4 in August, with both the present situation index and expectations index modestly declining. (The Conference Board, 8/26/25)- Core PCE inflation increased \(0.27\%\) M/M and \(2.9\%\) Y/Y in July, in-line with expectations. (BEA, 8/29/25)

- The EU announced detailed proposals to cut import duties to \(0\%\) on US products such as rubber, fertilizers, pharmaceutical products, inorganic chemicals and plastics including PE. (ICIS, 8/29/25)- According to market sources, Dow has delayed a turnaround for its Plaquemine, LA cracker until 2Q26. The LHC3 unit was originally scheduled for maintenance beginning in August and expected to run through September. The unit has an ethylene capacity of 1.055mmpta and a propylene capacity of 390kpta. (ICIS, 8/28/25)- LYB's La Porte, TX unit with 1.2mmpta ethylene capacity and 286kpta propylene capacity was reported to be shut down earlier this week due to a process gas compressor issue. According to the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality, the investigation to identify the root cause of the event is ongoing. (ICIS, 8/25/25)- India's Bharat Petroleum Corp Ltd (BPCL) begun work including land acquisition and other pre-project activities on its new 9mm tonne/year greenfield refinery and petrochemical project. The complex is expected to have an ethylene capacity of 1.5mmpta. BPCL also indicated that its brownfield expansion of the Bina refinery project including a 1.2mmpta ethylene cracker is on track for completion by mid-28 and expects to produce 1.15mmpta of PE and 550kpta of PP and other chemicals like benzene, toluene, xylene, and others. (company press release, 8/26/25)- Citroniq announced it is targeting its proposed world's first commercial-scale renewable PP plant to start-up in 2029. The company signed a supply agreement with ABB, which will provide automation, electrification, and digitalization solutions once Citroniq makes a FID. The plant's operations will begin by dehydrating corn-based ethanol to produce ethylene, which will be converted into propylene and subsequently into PP. (company press release, 8/25/25)- North American chemical rail traffic data jumped \(-13\%\) Y/Y for the week ending August 23, following a \(-0.3\%\) Y/Y increase from the prior week. The sharp increase was due to labor disruptions in Canada last year. Volumes were up \(0.4\%\) in US, up \(60.9\%\) in Canada and decreased \(16.1\%\) in Mexico. On a YTD basis, volumes are up \(1.7\%\) in US, up \(1.7\%\) in Canada, and down \(20.5\%\) in Mexico. (ICIS, 8/27/25)
- DuPont (DD.N) - Portfolio Realignment with Divestiture campaigns Business for \(\) 1.8bn\$
- Global Chemicals Cracker - Potential downside management while more supply is being shut
- US Chemicals — Periodic Crowding Target: Weekly Valuation and Crowding Overview
- Ecolab Inc (ECL.N): ECL Investor Day Preview; Expect More Detail on Path to 20% Operating Margin by 2027
- Westlake (WLK.N): WLK Announces Acquisition of ACI Compounding Solutions Business
- Sherwin Williams (SHW.N) - Don't Let a Downturn Go to Waste; Takeaways from Dinner with the Executive Team
- North America Commodity Chemicals: South Korea to Cut Naphtha-Cracking Capacity to Restore Financial Competitiveness
Natural Gas Liquids (NGL) Prices (c/gal)

Ethane/Propane Prices - Ethane prices at Mont Belvieu were flat W/W at \(\sim 21\) c/gal, Propane prices were up 3c W/W at \(\sim 69\) c/gal and Butane prices were up 1c W/W at \(\sim 80\) c/gal for the week ended 8/14.
Source: Chemical Market Analytics

Ethylene Margins - Spot weighted- average US ethylene margins were down \~2c W/W at \~8c/lb for the week ended 8/21. Ethane (10c) was the most favored feedstock, followed by Propane (0c), Butane (- 1c), & Naphtha (- 3c). Not all producers have exposure to spot economics.
North American Ethylene & Polyethylene Prices (c/lb)
Source: Chemical Market Analytics

Ethylene & Polyethylene (PE) – US July HDPE contract price were flat M/M at 78c/lb. Both LLDPE and LDPE July contract prices were flat M/M at 79c/lb and 84c/lb, respectively. While contract prices were reported flat for all grades, net transaction prices (NTP) were adjusted downwards by 3 cpp for all grades, reflecting discounts that have occurred in the market over the January through July period. For context, the last time NTP was adjusted differently than contract pricing was January 2025. US July ethylene contract price increased \~1.5c to \~32c/lb.
North American Propylene & Polypropylene Prices (c/lb)
Source: Chemical Market Analytics
Propylene & Polypropylene – US July propylene prices and PP (homopolymer prices) decreased \~1c M/M at 37.5c/lb and 51.5c/lb, respectively.
Methanol Prices (\$/mt)

Methanol – US spot methanol prices were down ~ \(7 W/W\) at \(\) 321/mt\(and China prices were down\) \sim \$7W/W\(at\) \ \(264/mt\) for the week ended 8/15. Not all producers have exposure to spot economics.
Lithium Spot Prices (\$/t)
Lithium carbonate (battery grade) spot price was down \~ \(34 W/W\) at \~ \(9,959/t\) and Li hydroxide spot price was up \~ \(143 W/W\) at \~ \(9,363/t\) for the week ended 8/22.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do
not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

Investing in non- U.S. securities, including ADRs, may entail certain risks. The securities of non- U.S. issuers may not be registered with, nor be subject to the reporting requirements of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Foreign companies are generally not subject to uniform audit and reporting standards, practices and requirements comparable to those in the U.S. Securities of some foreign companies may be less liquid and their prices more volatile than securities of comparable U.S. companies.
